name: Easy Allons-y Alonso Trivia Quiz | USA - Cities | 10 Questions

questions.text: First off, Alonso visits Ellis Island. He then takes the ferry back to the mainland and drives to the Baseball Hall of Fame. From there he goes to this state's capital. What city does he end up in?
questions.explanation:
Albany.

	Albany County was established in 1683. The city Albany itself did not become the capital of New York until 1797.

questions.text: Alonso next drives to the place where the Basketball Hall of Fame is located. After that, he drives a bit to take in a game at Fenway Park.  Finally, he walks along the Freedom Trail. What is the capital of the state that Alonso is in now?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	Boston was founded in 1630 on the 7th of September. It is the capital city of Massachusetts.

questions.text: Alonso decides to see the Sears Tower and Columbus Park in another state. He then heads to the capital city; where is he now?
questions.explanation:
Springfield.

	The Sears Tower and Columbus Park are located in Chicago, Illinois. Since Chicago is the most famous city in Illinois, people often think it is the state capital.  In reality, the capital is Springfield, which was founded in 1821.

questions.text: Alonso doesn't like to stay in any one state too long, so he continues on his way.  This time he decides to see a car race at this state's motor speedway.  He also visits the birthplace of Michael Jackson. What is this state's capital city?
questions.explanation:
Indianapolis.

	Indianapolis became the capital of Indiana in 1820.  The state is well-known for the Indy 500, a car race at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway in the city of Speedway. Gary, Indiana is the city where Michael Jackson was from. Incidentally, former Celtics player Larry Bird is from French Lick, while actress Vivica Fox is from South Bend.

questions.text: Next Alonso decides to see the landmark Gateway Arch. While he's there he catches a Rams football game.  Then he heads to this Midwestern state's capital. What capital is he in now?
questions.explanation:
Jefferson City.

	The Gateway Arch is 630 feet high. Jefferson City is located in Missouri.  The city was named after Thomas Jefferson, the third president of the United States.

questions.text: Alonso continues on his journey and ends up visiting the childhood home of Helen Keller, called Ivy Green. He then heads to the capital city to the see Civil Rights Memorial. What state capital is he in now?
questions.explanation:
Montgomery.

	Montgomery, Alabama was founded in 1819.  It became the state capital in 1946.  Martin Luther King, Jr. was once in prison in Birmingham, Alabama for protesting the treatment of black people.

questions.text: Alonso next heads to a place where you can see the Alamo. He then goes west to see the Space Center. Finally, he visits the state capital. Where is he now?
questions.explanation:
Austin.

	Austin is located in central Texas. It was founded in 1837, and became the state capital only two years later in 1839.

questions.text: Alonso goes to the state where he can explore Carlsbad Caverns National Park.  He's also planning to visit the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum, which is located in the capital of the state. Where is Alonso?
questions.explanation:
Santa Fe.

	Santa Fe was made the capital of the New Mexico territory in 1851. When New Mexico became a state, Santa Fe became its capital in 1912.  Georgia O'Keeffe was a famous painter, and the museum is dedicated to her work.

questions.text: Alonso has heard a lot of things about Las Vegas, so he decides to go see it for himself. He then walks along Fremont Street. What is the capital city of the  state he is in now?
questions.explanation:
Carson City.

	Carson City became the state capital in 1864, which is the same year that Nevada became a state.  Carson City is home to the Nevada State Railroad Museum. Las Vegas is famous for its gambling casinos.

questions.text: Finally, Alonso visits one last state capital. In this state, he's able to go to Hollywood and Rodeo Drive. He then goes to the capital to see the Tower Bridge. What is this last capital that Alonso has visited?
questions.explanation:
Sacramento.

	Sacramento became the state capital of California in 1854.  Hollywood is located in Los Angeles. Rodeo Drive is a big shopping area in Beverly Hills.
